user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				    struct linux_device *ldev,
				    uint32_t dir,
				    struct metal_sg *sg,
				    int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				    struct linux_device *ldev,
				    uint32_t dir,
				    struct metal_sg *sg,
				    int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The provided function metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap contains no function calls at all — its body only casts each parameter to void to suppress unused-parameter warnings. There are no calls to itself (direct recursion) and no calls to any other functions that could form an indirect recursion chain. The function is declared static (translation-unit scope), so there are no visible external linkage concerns in the snippet. The duplicate definition in the additional code is identical and likewise contains no calls; it does not introduce recursion. There are also no function-pointer uses, callbacks, or macro expansions in the supplied code that could cause indirect self-calls. Therefore, based on the code provided, there are no fragments that warrant investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 (functions shall not call themselves). If code outside this snippet (not provided) contains calls or function-pointer wiring that could cause recursion, that is beyond the scope of the supplied code and would need separate review.
